season_summary_source_note: Analysis based solely on weekly summaries provided (Weeks 1-8). Records and season points-for used are the latest reported values in the weekly inputs; win/losss updated where Week 8 results were provided.

general_trends: Weeks 1-8 saw a mix of very high-scoring outputs (multiple teams >140 in a week) and very low outputs (<60). Outcomes have often been decided by single-player blowups or bench management.
D/STs and kickers have swung several matchups (examples: Vikings D/ST 32 in Week 3; Browns D/ST 24 and Buccaneers D/ST 25 in Week 7; multiple kickers with 17+ points across weeks).

Bench/lineup decisions are a recurring theme league-wide: many teams repeatedly left 20+ point performances on the bench (notable examples across weeks include Daniel Jones 29.48, Wan'Dale Robinson 28.2, Bijan Robinson 35.8, Rico Dowdle 33.9, Justin Fields/Jordan Love 25–29 range).
notable_upsets_and_close_games: Very narrow finishes: Team Santangelo 125.44 defeated Big Trouble in Little Cameron 125.18 (0.26 margin, Week 5).
High combined scoring close games: If Ur Not First You're Last 145.78 beat Team Santangelo 142.78 by 2 points (Week 2).
Dominant offensive outputs that produced blowouts: SnydeRemarks 161.14 (Week 5) and Trying to not finish last 153.16 (Week 7) were decisive blowouts driven by individual outbursts.
owner_behavior_themes: Conservative/overcautious benching: Multiple owners consistently left high-upside QBs or pass-catchers inactive (examples: Michael Penix Jr., Daniel Jones, Jordan Love, Justin Fields, Bijan Robinson, Wan'Dale Robinson).
Aggressive risk with weekly streaming at D/ST and kickers: Several matchups were decided by streaming choices (Saints, Jaguars, Rams, Browns, Buccaneers D/STs produced multi-turnover games).

Frequent inactive/BYE impacts: Owners have had to navigate many BYEs/IR (e.g., Brock Purdy inactives, Joe Burrow IR, Mark Andrews BYE, Puka Nacua BYE), and some lineups did not adjust optimally — producing material scoring left unused.

standings_snapshot_and_playoff_projectio.method_note: Playoff projection uses record first, then highest season points-for (latest reported PF in weekly inputs) to break multi-team 4-4 ties.

projected_playoff_teams_top_6.short_analysis: Consistent high-floor roster and recent 3–game run into Week 8; Saquon/Tucker Kraft/TE production + strong defensive weeks have driven wins.
Highest season points-for in the league; heavily driven by Christian McCaffrey and multiple explosive WR/QB weeks, but late two-game slide (Weeks 7–8) is a caution.
Scoring engine built around George Pickens and receiver breakouts; solid defense weeks. A narrow loss in Week 8 dropped momentum but still top three by record.
High points-for among 4-4 teams — recent huge weeks (Bo Nix, Jonathan Taylor) push this team into projected playoff contention via PF tiebreaker.
Explosive WR weeks (Ja'Marr Chase, DeVonta Smith) and occasional elite bench scoring; sits third among 4-4 teams by PF.
Balanced attack with multiple different weekly lead scorers (Cam Skattebo, Rashee Rice, Josh Allen when active) and D/ST contributions; enough cumulative scoring to win tiebreak over other 4-4 teams.

notable_teams_missing_playoffs_if_projec: Jake Butt Stuff (4-4, PF ~736): multiple recent losses and several inactive/no-shows on expected scorers have limited upward mobility.
If Ur Not First You're Last (4-4, PF ~768): record tied but PF behind top 4-4 teams; inconsistent WR production and some big negative deltas have reduced ceiling.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Relies on steady RB outputs and occasional elite TE/kicker performances; has won several weeks via RB + D/ST + kicker outperformance.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Strong start into mid-season; improved to 6-2 after Week 8 win over If Ur Not First You're Last.

player_impact_trends.Saquon Barkley: Boom/bust weeks — has both >30-point weeks and single-digit busts; still a key contributor when healthy.
player_impact_trends.Tucker Kraft (TE): Has produced massive outperformance weeks (33.3 in Week 8) that swing matchups.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Occasional conservative benching (e.g., Wan'Dale Robinson 28.2 left on bench in Week 5) — owner still finding optimal weekly lineups.
notable_bench_management_examples: Left Wan'Dale Robinson on the bench in Week 5 despite 28.2 points.
Managed BYE weeks (Davante Adams BYE Week 8) without collapsing the starting lineup.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Very high variance offense driven by Christian McCaffrey, occasional elite WR weeks (Emeka Egbuka, Marvin Harrison Jr.), and QB rushing weeks from Lamar Jackson when active.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Hot early (multiple dominant weeks including 161.14 in Week 5), then cooled with losses in Week 7 and Week 8.

player_impact_trends.Christian McCaffrey: Primary engine; has multiple monster weeks (24+, 39.1) and also a low week (9.8 in Week 8) which heavily moves team totals.
When they pop, team ceilings spike; owners have occasionally left Egbuka/Doubs on bench in games where they also performed.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Bench management has been mixed — owner has left very productive QBs or WRs on bench in several weeks (Romeo Doubs 29.8 bench in Week 4; Jordan Love 28.3 bench Week 8), sometimes hurting margin.
notable_bench_management_examples: Romeo Doubs scored 29.8 in Week 4 but was left on bench.
Jordan Love scored 28.3 in Week 8 but was benched in another owner’s matchup; SnydeRemarks faced multiple BYE/IR constraints (Lamar Jackson IR/BYE).

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Receiver-driven with George Pickens and Ladd McConkey frequently posting big weeks; RB room capable of blowups but also subject to BYEs/inactives.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Had been 5-2 heading into Week 8 but lost that week (now 5-3); still a top-3 record team by W-L.

player_impact_trends.George Pickens: Repeatedly provides major weekly ceilings (multiple 30+ games), carrying the team in wins.
player_impact_trends.Bijan Robinson: Produced a very large bench score Week 6/7 (35.8) when inactive; owner must manage usage around BYE/inactive situations.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Bench decisions have cost margin (Bijan benching in Week 6 produced big unused points).
notable_bench_management_examples: Left Bijan Robinson (35.8) on bench in Week 6 — large unused scoring.
Marvin Mims Jr. produced 20.5 but was benched Week 4.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Huge upside from Jonathan Taylor in multiple weeks and occasional elite QB weeks (Bo Nix). Strong D/ST weeks (Patriots D/ST 20 Week 7).
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Had a big offensive explosion in Week 7 (153.16) that pushed season PF high and improved playoff tiebreak positioning.

player_impact_trends.Jonathan Taylor: Has multiple 30+ point weeks that directly correlate with team wins.
player_impact_trends.Bo Nix: One enormous QB week (39.96) swung a matchup and reflects owner’s willingness to roster/ride breakout QB weeks.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner sometimes benches high-scoring backups (e.g., Joe Flacco left on bench Week 8 with 24.32) — conservative approach but high-impact when starters perform.
notable_bench_management_examples: Left Joe Flacco (24.32) on the bench in Week 8 while starting Bo Nix.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: High-ceiling receiving corps (Ja'Marr Chase, DeVonta Smith) capable of massive weeks; occasionally misses RB/kicker contributions.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Recovered after early variance to log several big weeks (134.5 in Week 7); sits in playoff contention via points-for.

player_impact_trends.Ja'Marr Chase / DeVonta Smith: Both had 30+ point weeks (Week 7) that produced the single highest team weekly total in Week 7 (134.5).
player_impact_trends.Justin Herbert: When Herbert performs (multi-TD games), team ceilings increase substantially.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner sometimes benches productive QBs (Jordan Love 28.3 left on bench Week 8) — suggests caution when deciding QB starts.
notable_bench_management_examples: Jordan Love 28.3 left on bench in Week 8 — major unused scoring in a week the team needed depth.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Balanced contributors across RB/WR/QB; has benefitted from surprise RB breakouts (Ashton Jeanty, Cam Skattebo) and positive D/ST outputs.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: After early mixed results, the team has posted multiple wins leveraging diverse weekly lead scorers.

player_impact_trends.Cam Skattebo / Ashton Jeanty: Both have produced week-winning starts (31.0, 33.5), showing depth at RB is a recurring strength.
player_impact_trends.Justin Fields: Has produced big bench numbers multiple times; owner occasionally elects to start Fields or keep him as bench insurance.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner tends to keep high-upside QBs in rotation and sometimes benches them (Justin Fields as a bench asset in Week 8).
notable_bench_management_examples: Rico Dowdle had a 33.9 bench score in Week 6 (unused).
Justin Fields was benched in Week 8 though he produced ~20 points.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Relies on WR production and TE spikes, but QB instability and inactives (CeeDee Lamb multiple times) have produced volatile weekly totals.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Started season well but has alternated wins and losses with notable collapses tied to expected WR busts or inactives.

player_impact_trends.Caleb Williams: Has had both high-output mobility weeks and several underperformances that correlate to team losses.
player_impact_trends.CeeDee Lamb: Multiple game absences/inactives (e.g., Week 4, Week 6) have materially lowered the floor.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Repeatedly impacted by inactives and BYEs; occasional benching choices left useful points unused (Cam Ward, Chiefs D/ST at times).
notable_bench_management_examples: CeeDee Lamb listed Inactive in several weeks (Week 4, Week 6) — lost expected production.
Harold Fannin Jr. produced 18.4 in Week 8 but team still lost.

team_trends.team: If Ur Not First You're Last
team_trends.scoring_pattern: High-ceiling via Mahomes + WRs; results swing with WR health and opponent DST/kicker outperformance. Kicker and DST have occasionally provided outsized scoring.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: After an early 2–0 start, team has leveled into .500 with volatile weekly outputs (big weeks vs. bust weeks).

player_impact_trends.Patrick Mahomes: Consistent positively correlated with team wins; Mahomes has had multiple above-projection weeks.
player_impact_trends.Rome Odunze / Malik Nabers: When both produce, team tends to win; Nabers had several big outbursts but also multiple large negative deltas.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner has sometimes left useful bench RBs/WRs unused (Jeremy McNichols, Nick Chubb on bench Week 8), costing margin in close matchups.
notable_bench_management_examples: Left Jeremy McNichols and Nick Chubb on bench in Week 8 while kicker Chris Boswell had 20 points for opponent.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Leans on Amon-Ra St. Brown and Jalen Hurts; TE and kicker spikes (Goedert, Fairbairn) have been decisive in close outcomes.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Mixed results week-to-week with a number of nail-biters and one-point/low-margin contests.

player_impact_trends.Amon-Ra St. Brown: Has delivered massive single-game ceilings (39.2 in Week 2) that directly produced wins.
player_impact_trends.Jalen Hurts: When Hurts runs/throws effectively, team ceiling increases; his underperformances have coincided with losses.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner has occasionally left high-scoring bench pieces (Stefon Diggs, Dallas Goedert in Week 4) inactive — a recurring missed-opportunity pattern.
notable_bench_management_examples: Stefon Diggs (16.1) and Dallas Goedert (19.7) were benched Week 4 with significant points left unused.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Strong moments from RB Jahmyr Gibbs and WR Jaxon Smith-Njigba produce big weekly spikes; QB instability (Purdy inactives) has required frequent bench management.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Recovered from early losses via a few dominant offensive weeks (notably Week 3 and Week 7).

player_impact_trends.Jahmyr Gibbs: Has produced multiple 20+ and an elite 36.8 week that correlate strongly with wins.
player_impact_trends.Courtland Sutton / Jaxon Smith-Njigba: Key WRs who deliver pivotal weekly scoring.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner has often had Brock Purdy inactive or benched Jared Goff decisions that produced large bench scores (Goff 33.96 bench in Week 2, 20.12 bench in Week 5).
notable_bench_management_examples: Jared Goff produced 33.96 in Week 2 but was on the bench; Woody Marks 27.9 benched in Week 4.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: TE and WR have produced strong weeks (Jake Ferguson, Keenan Allen); however QB instability and RB volatility (Kenneth Walker, Quinshon Judkins) lead to swings.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Inconsistent — can produce high totals (over 120) but also fold when QB or RBs underperform.

player_impact_trends.Jake Ferguson: Multiple strong TE weeks that have been primary scoring anchors.
player_impact_trends.Keenan Allen / Nico Collins: When healthy and targeted, they produce high WR ceilings; multiple BYEs/inactives have impacted the roster.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Has repeatedly left high bench QB scores unused (Daniel Jones 29.48 in Week 3; 23.18 in Week 8), indicating conservative QB starts or misreads on matchups.
notable_bench_management_examples: Daniel Jones scored 29.48 in Week 3 but was left on the bench.
Dak Prescott produced 30.96 in Week 4 but was benched in favor of another starter.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Runs through Javonte Williams, Deebo Samuel, and the occasional QB breakout (Jaxson Dart) — when the RB/WR tandem hits, team wins.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Started poorly in early weeks, has had intermittent strong offensive outputs (Week 8 blowup with Troy Franklin/Bills D/ST).

player_impact_trends.Javonte Williams: Multiple 20+ point games, important positive delta contributor.
player_impact_trends.Troy Franklin: Week 8 breakout (26.9) paired with Bills D/ST 18.0 led to one of the team's largest weekly totals.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Missed opportunities when established starters (Derrick Henry, Deebo in some weeks) underperformed or were inactive; benching of late-week breakouts has occasionally occurred.
notable_bench_management_examples: Kimani Vidal scored 22.8 in Week 6 but was a bench asset.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Heavy passing construction with Kelce/Stafford/Puka when healthy; very vulnerable to Puka/Jameson Williams inactives or bust weeks.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Mixed — has both comfortable wins and some heavy misses (e.g., Puka Nacua 4.8 Week 6).

player_impact_trends.Travis Kelce: When he explodes (21.9 Week 8), the team frequently wins; Kelce is a steady high-floor point earner.
player_impact_trends.Puka Nacua / Jameson Williams: Dependence on top WRs creates vulnerability when either is inactive or held to a low total.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Owner has benched high-output QBs at times (C.J. Stroud left on bench Weeks 5/6/8) producing large unused totals.
notable_bench_management_examples: C.J. Stroud produced 28.76 in Week 5 but was left on bench; Puka Nacua on BYE Week 8 limited starting options.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Rookie QB play (Drake Maye), Michael Pittman Jr., and surprising RB bursts (De'Von Achane/Omarion Hampton) combine with occasional massive D/ST weeks (Browns 24).
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: After early hiccups, posted very large weekly totals (147.28 in Week 7) to regain competitiveness.

player_impact_trends.De'Von Achane: When he gets work and the offense flows, he creates explosive weeks (31.0 Week 7).

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Has a pattern of leaving large bench RB/QB scores unused (Kenneth Gainwell 31.4 bench Week 4; Michael Penix Jr. benched multiple times).
notable_bench_management_examples: Kenneth Gainwell 31.4 left on bench Week 4; Michael Penix Jr. benched in earlier weeks despite solid outputs.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Has sporadic elite RB weeks (Kyren Williams), but QB and WR inactives/BYEs and repeated bench mismanagement have produced multiple sub-70 weeks.
team_trends.streaks_turnarounds: Sporadic wins; large bench scores (Aaron Rodgers 22.56 Week 7) often unused.

player_impact_trends.Kyren Williams: Has produced large positive deltas (31.1 Week 5) that correlate with wins.
player_impact_trends.Justin Jefferson: When active and targeted, he provides expected elite totals, but owner sometimes benches or has him on bye.

team_trends.owner_behavior_notes: Repeated binder of benching top-week scorers (Aaron Rodgers, Justin Jefferson) and poor QB starts have cost several matchups.
notable_bench_management_examples: Aaron Rodgers 22.56 left on bench (Week 7); Justin Jefferson benched Week 8 for a low team total.

repeat_high_impact_performers.trend: Has repeatedly produced week-winning, high-ceiling outputs (24.1, 39.1) — his variance directly maps to that team's win/loss swings.

teams_impacted: If Ur Not First You're Last
repeat_high_impact_performers.trend: Regularly outperforms QB projections and is central to top-team weekly ceilings.
Both posted monster weeks (Week 7) that created the league's top single-week team score.

repeat_high_impact_performers.player: Jahmyr Gibbs / Jonathan Taylor / Josh Jacobs
teams_impacted: If Ur Not First You're Last
repeat_high_impact_performers.trend: Each RB has produced single-game explosions that directly secured wins; RB outliers have been among the most decisive events.

repeat_underperformers_and_risk_position.trend: Several expected weekly leaders have had low or zero point games which have caused major negative deltas for their managers. These bust weeks frequently correlate with manager losses.
Unlike many leagues, D/ST and kicker have produced outsized single-week swings; streaming these positions has been a successful, high-variance strategy.

common_mistakes: Benching high-upside bench QBs and pass-catchers late in the day has cost many owners numerous matchups (multiple documented cases across weeks).
Failing to adjust for BYE/IR early (e.g., Joe Burrow IR, mark Andrews BYE) created predictable low-floor weeks for several teams.
Overreliance on a single star without stacking reliable complementary pieces (RB/TE/secondary WR) has left some teams vulnerable when that star busts.
successful_behaviors: Active streamer approach for D/ST and kickers has paid off for owners who pick matchup-based defenses (multiple games won or flipped by D/ST outperformance).
Maintaining RB depth and rotating based on matchup/usage (several teams with strong bench RB results) has produced consistent positive deltas.

highest_impact_instances.example: Hangin' With Mr. Cooper left Michael Penix Jr. (24.02) on the bench — a major missed swing.
Big Trouble in Little Cameron left Daniel Jones (29.48) on the bench, a potential reversal of a blowout loss.
Kraft Montgomery Cheese left Wan'Dale Robinson (28.2) on bench while still winning — huge unused scoring.
Forte Inch Johnson left Rico Dowdle (33.9) on the bench (unused) while winning; illustrates recurring owner caution.
Multiple managers left Jordan Love (28.3), Justin Fields (~20+), Daniel Jones (~23) on bench across matchups — collective league pattern.

injury_bye_ir_watch: Multiple rosters show repeated IR/BYE impacts (Joe Burrow IR, Mark Andrews BYE, Puka Nacua BYE). Owners should be tracked for continued roster disruption.
Quarterback inactives have been frequent and have forced heavy bench shuffling (Brock Purdy, Kyler Murray).
momentum_and_regression_alerts: SnydeRemarks: High PF but two straight losses — watch whether reliance on CMC and volatile supporting cast leads to regression or a bounce-back.
Kraft Montgomery Cheese: consistently winning — likely to remain a top seed if current scoring mix holds.
Teams with multiple bench-mismanagement incidents (Jake Butt Stuff, Big Trouble, Dickhole Smashers) risk falling out of contention if lineup decisions persist.
